result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:21 AM Defendant MICHAEL SHANE COYLE in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for MICHAEL SHANE COYLE.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint in 22CF602. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. 
No agreement at this time given new charges. 
Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MICHAEL SHANE COYLE in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for MICHAEL SHANE COYLE. 
Resolution has been reached, working out final details. 
Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:41 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MICHAEL SHANE COYLE in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for MICHAEL SHANE COYLE. 
Close to resolution. Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cases#21CF603 and 22CF29
1:29 PM Defendant MICHAEL SHANE COYLE in court.  Attorney Scott Zehr in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for MICHAEL SHANE COYLE.  Attorney Linzmeier states she's representing defendant on Case#21CF603 and she'll have the PD's office add her on for Case#22CF29.  
ADA Zehr requests to dismiss defendant's motion to suppress without evidentiary hearing.  Attorney Linzmeier objects.  Court states this was a warrant and defendant was arrested.  Attorney Linzmeier responds.  ADA Zehr makes arguments as to timing.  Attorney Linzmeier responds.  Court grants dismissal of defendant's motion to suppress.  Court further schedules hearing for 07/05/2022 at 9:30 a.m.  Court adjourns.
